intro: Jailoloa halmaherensis, commonly known as the Halmahera jailoloa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Halmahera Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from bright red to deep purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of its native habitat. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
